Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dickens.blogapp.user.UserController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    Rest controller class which holds user related endpoints.

    3.0

    Tommi Lepola, Ville-Veikko Nieminen

    • Method Detail

      • getUsers

        @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ADMIN\')")
@GetMapping(value="users",
            produces="application/hal+json")
public org.springframework.hateoas.Resources<User> getUsers()
        Returns all users and links related to them following the HATEOAS approach.

        The method was made simply for learning purposes, it's not really used on the front-end side.

        Returns:
        all users and endpoints related to them.

      • deleteUser

        @Transactional
@PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ADMIN\')")
@DeleteMapping("users/{userId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteUser​(@PathVariable
                                                             java.lang.Long userId)
        Deletes user with the given userId.
        Parameters:
        userId - userId of the user to be deleted.
        Returns:
        HTTP response 204 if succesful
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - with status 404 and message if user with given id was not found.

      • getAllUsers

        @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ADMIN\')")
@GetMapping("users/all")
public java.lang.Iterable<User> getAllUsers()
        Returns all users.
        Returns:
        all users.

      • editUserRole

        @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'ADMIN\')")
@PostMapping("users/role/{userId}/{isAdmin}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> editUserRole​(@PathVariable
                                                               java.lang.Long userId,
                                                               @PathVariable
                                                               boolean isAdmin)
        Either elevates or de-elevates user's role.

        The method is used to edit given user's role. The method is given userId and boolean as a parameter to determine the edited user and the user's new role.

        Parameters:
        userId - userId of the user to be edited.
        isAdmin - either "true" to indicate that user should be admin, or "false" to indicate that user should not be admin.
        Returns:
        HTTP response 200 with message if succesful.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - with status 404 and message with user with given id was not found.

      • getDetails

        @PreAuthorize("hasRole(\'USER\')")
@GetMapping("/users/details")
@Transactional
public org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails getDetails()
        Returns user's details when user has logged in, to determine user's name, id and such on the frontend side for different kinds of actions.
        Returns:
        users details in a UserDetails object
